captions.text: - [Voiceover] Man, I'm so hungry.

Wait, am I just bored?
Eh, I'll eat anyways.
Why don't I ever buy food?

What's good in here?
Mmm, bread. Cool, cool.
How old is this? Ugh!
Well, I'll just put it back for now.

Alright, cheese, well,
grilled cheese it is.
Am I supposed to use olive oil or butter?

Butter is worse for
you, but I think I read

that cooking with olive
oil is a waste of money.

And isn't most olive oil
not actually olive oil?
Wait, what oil is it?
I should make

a documentary about that:
"The Faults in Our Oil",
"The Fault in Our Olives?"
Oh, this is gonna be so good.
Who started cooking in the first place?
It's crazy that you can just
turn on fire whenever you want.

I feel like fire is a
responsibility you have
to earn, like driving.
Have I earned it?
Is American cheese even cheese?
What does that say about America?
Who cares? Shit tastes good.
It is the exact consistency
of Elmer's Glue when it melts though.

Cooking is so fun! I
should do it more often.
I could be a chef, like an artist,

but my paint is food
and my canvas, a plate.
Like Mario [bleep] Batali, but a lady.
I could have my own restaurant,
wear one of those cool shirts.
What would it be named though?
Oooh, "B and B: Bourbon and Breakfast."

I'd serve waffles and
bourbon and nothing else.
Maybe I should serve grilled cheese.
Oh dang, did I burn this?
Alright, no, it's good.
Ugh, no plates.

"No Plates", that's a good
name for a restaurant.
(upbeat jazz music)
(crunch)

There is a authentic Italian place not far from where I live that doesn't 
have any plates, unless you order pizza your meal comes in a steel frying 
pan placed on a cork board. Most of the meals can be half eaten, you take 
it home, add some pasta and a few extra pieces of whatever meat was in your 
dish and you have another whole meal.﻿

supper.﻿

comments.text:
Butter is very healthy as much as olive oil. Oils that come from plants for 
example soy oil, sunflower oil, are all very, very unhealthy for your body 
and this type of oil can cause heart attacks. Oilve oil is healthy because 
it's not "factory made" which means it's not a "wannabe" oil, It has many 
benefits and very natural which is why it's healthy for you. Next time 
anyone says that butter, heavy cream cheese and anything that includes 
"fat" in it is actually going to make you fat then it's absolutely false. 
Don't eat food that has oils that are factory made or come from any other 
plant besides oilves.﻿
